comment: Great when you listen to her lecture. Gives out homework and tests like it is candy. Never sticks to the original syllabus.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Shabazi is one of the best professors here at KSU! She is kind, caring, intellectual, and hardworking. Definitely go to office hours to discuss any questions you have about the course and she will explain them very well. Work hard, and show your dedication to the class and you will definitely get an A! :)
rating_tags: Respected--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is amazing. If you have the opportunity to take her, do it! She's a wonderful person & professor; one of the best @ KSU! She really cares about her students & I have learned so much from being in her classes. She's very knowledgeable on the topics & always willing to help her students truly understand. Overall, great experience! :)!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Take her she is a sweet woman!

She is an amazing teacher for lab. I am sure she would be fine for lecture too, but if you have the option to choose her for lab, you absolutely must. She guides you through the labs and answers any questions. There is no lab reports or homework. There are 4 tests that are easy and 4 post lab tests that are easier.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: This is one of the best lab teachers I had ever had. She is really caring and explains everything you need to see in the lab before the class is over. You have tests over each lab, but they are really easy and should be easy A's. Ps, sometimes give the answers before class is over.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Grade consists of attendance, 4 post lab practice tests, and 4 post lab tests. Tests are easy and mostly straight from the lab handouts. Get to use handouts on tests and not on lockdown browser.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Caring

comment: This class was made online due to the pandemic which is a challenge within itself. For lecture, she basically just read off a powerpoint verbatim. At this point, I'm just memorizing content and then regurgitating it out on the test. She also likes to pick the most miniscule things out of a chapter and put it on a test or quiz.

She seemed to revel in how difficult she made this course. I've taken intro to parasitology at another university and loved it, recieved a high B. The quizzes are FULL lockdown browser and extremely difficult. The amount of specificity she expects from intro class is utterly ridiculous. I love parasitology and she made me hate this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She really wants to see you do well and loves to see effort on your half. Attend lectures to get info for the exams. Your grade is 4 exams and some extra credit. She is veryyyy understanding and at the end after working really hard each exam she rounded my 88.9 to an A! Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took this class in the summer and it was not easy. The professor makes it easy to understand and will answer any questions. She offered practice tests and review sessions that help a lot. If you miss a class or a review session it will be difficult to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 4 tests, no homework, no extra credit. took this for a summer class. it was fine, you do have to actually put in work to pass the class. you're graded on 4 tests ONLY, so theres really no room for you to fail. The tests are doable as long as you attend the lectures, study and do the practice exam. great professor but do have to work for your grade.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is an amazing professor. Lab usually ended early, and she was always available to stay back after lab and explain concepts that I didnt understand. She wants her students to suceed. DONT BE AFRAID TO STAY BACK AND ASK QUESTIONS! She has office hours where you can review old tests and ask questions. Optinal final at the end helps alot.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great person for lab and very caring. Lab quizzes are difficult though, but if you study you will do well. Final is optional and she has some extra-credit. Very nice person overall.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor showed how she cared for her students but her accent was hard to understand at times during her instructions and lectures. Half of the time she did not want to answer questions that students had and that made it hard to ask her a question. Tests are pretty similar to the quizzes on d2l. Pay attention and take notes during lecture

Dr. Shahbazi is extremely knowledgeable. She definitely cares about her students being successful & is always willing to help answer questions. Made the class fun and interesting. With our class she had time for test reviews & they helped tremendously. She goes over everything you need to know. 100% recommended her. Still have to put in work tho!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Knowledgeable, caring, and willing to help. Just prepared to work hard for your grade. Not an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: she's a nice person and all.. but this class is very stressful. Each powerpoint is like 100 slides each---OVERLOAD of study material. only 1 midterm and 1 final. No study guide either. If you're lucky she'll do a review. The class is do-able--- just know what you're signing up for. Alright, that's enough from me....... back to suffering...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is a wonderful professor. She wants her students to succeed, if the student puts forth the effort, and is very easy to get in contact with outside of class. There is a lot of content in this class but it is interesting and she tells you EXACTLY what will be on the exams. She is very sweet and truly does care about the students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is an extremely sweet woman. She cares about her students and really wants you to do well in her class. Some students complain about her accent but she is very articulate. You can understand her just fine unless you do not listen. Also I purchased the text but it was unnecessary its exactly what she says in lectures and on her ppts.
rating_tags: Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: TERRIBLE ! RUN ! RUN ! Unclear about what she wants and makes you a bunch of unnecessary notes that will never be on the actual test. You have to literally beg and debate with this woman for her to tell you what will be on the test. This class is content heavy and she doesn't help with guiding study. She expects you to know the whole book & lecture
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I think she is a great professor. Initially, class takes some getting used to because her accent but its not hard to understand her and the course has heavy material. Its amazing how easy the tests are considering the amount of information you learn. I suggest quizlet to study. Shes clear on what will be tested. Shes very sweet & quite funny(:
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is an awesome professor. I have her for lecture and lab and she is very helpful for both. She is very approachable and wants to make sure you understand what she is teaching you. She makes it very clear what will show up on a test and what we are learning for just our understanding. Micro is very interesting and she knows her stuff!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Very clear in lectures on what will be tested. Tests are extremely easy. Only way to fail is to not show up for lecture. Powerpoints follow text almost word for word if you miss a class reading the text is the best way to catch up. Very accomplished professor. A true inspiration for young women interested in biological sciences.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Shahbazi has a strong accent, making it hard to follow her. She asks if students understand a topic and if no one responds or says no, she says okay and moves on; does not explain the topic. Her powerpoints are not the same on D2L as the ones she uses in lecture and she assumes everyone in lab is a professional microbiologist.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is an excellent educator. If you study the notes, you will pass. It helps if you make flashcards out of the notes (I used Anki). All in all, it was a very insightful class, she makes the content easy to understand. You earn the grade you work for.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is an amazing professor! There is a lot of information for Parasitology, but she makes it extremely interesting! You can tell that she is very passionate and knowledgeable from her lectures! She cares about the students success and gives you plenty of opportunities to succeed! If you put forth the effort then you will pass the class!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--Would take again

comment: I love Professor Shahbazi! Her accent is a little heavy, but she is very clear on instructions because she is aware of the fact that it may difficult to understand her. She gives bonus points on quizzes too for really good lab work. The final is super easy just make sure you go to the class before you take it because she pretty much goes over it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: One of the most caring and thoughtful professors I've ever had, but also one of the hardest. I took her for parasitology, and it was very interesting but also very tough. I am not exaggerating this one bit, but in our class of 23 students, there was 1 A at the end of the semester, ONE! Again, amazing woman and lecturer, but VERY hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: Dr. Shahbazi is hands down the best! She teaches by making the heavy course load (parasitology) interesting. She'll talk about her lab experiments and compare and contrast a lot. It's a lot to remember, but all you need to know for her tests are in her lecture notes! (except for bonus point questions)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--TEST HEAVY

comment: Very heavy accent but SUCH a sweet heart! omg I love her but those lab quizzes were SUPER hard. If you need help just go to her office and study... I mean REALLY study the lab before assessments. She's such an inspiration if you learn about her background in biology. REALLY wants her students to do well! This lab wasn't an easy A for me.
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: An amazing professor who cares for her students and makes sure they understand everything! Would recommend her for any class!!!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Caring

comment: She rocks!!!! So nice and such a good professor. She is so intelligent and cares about her students. Take her!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Amazing Professor! She does have an accent that can be difficult to understand sometimes, but she really cares about her students. Definitely would recommend!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: By far the best professor I've ever had! She is very kind and helpful in class. I would definitely recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Caring
